node.title: Amazon Drivers' Different Fates Highlight Cruel Randomness of Tornado Disaster
node.description: One died at the factory that collapsed while sheltering in a bathroom. Another might have too but for a colleague needing help after losing some keys.

node.title: Are wearable fitness trackers worth the money?
node.description: Wearable fitness trackers will be on many Christmas shopping lists this year,  but what does the latest research say about how effective they are?

node.title: If you thought foxes were cunning, wait until you hear this
node.description: Environmental groups are worried for shorebirds as foxes use low tide to access a remote island off Victoria's coast.

node.title: 'Hoping for miracles': US tornado victims died while huddled in Amazon facility
node.description: Rescue workers scour debris for survivors after a string of powerful tornadoes tears through the US Midwest, leaving residents without power, water or even a roof over their heads.

node.title: Cryptocurrencies on a knife edge: Is this the slow decline of Bitcoin?
node.description: While cryptocurrency millionaires allegedly abound, the real future for digital currencies looks far more conventional and state-controlled, writes Ian Verrender.

node.title: NSW records nine Omicron COVID cases as Newcastle nightclub cluster explodes
node.description: NSW Health says the state recorded nine new Omicron COVID-19 cases, bringing the total number to 64.

node.title: Transmission Gully will not open by Christmas
node.description: Transmission Gully will not be open before Christmas, despite the Transport Agency Waka Kotahi putting the pressure on its contractor to meet the target.

node.title: Alibaba Fires Woman Whose Rape Accusation Gripped China for 'Spreading Misinformation'
node.description: The case featured prominently in China's #MeToo movement and highlighted the difficulties Chinese women often face in assault allegations.

node.title: Manufacturing activity slows, employment in the sector contracts
node.description: Manufacturing activity contracted in November as deliveries, finished stock and employment activity slowed.

node.title: First Home Grant price cap changes won't come into effect until next year
node.description: The planned overhaul of First Home Grant income and property price caps won't happen until the New Year.

node.title: Amelia Kerr: My family saved my life
node.description: Amelia Kerr wants the world to understand the mental hell she's been through in the past 18 months. And the White Ferns wunderkind tells Kristy Havill how her family and those closest to her helped…

node.title: Vicente Fernández, ‘El Rey’ of Mexican Ranchera Music, Is Dead at 81
node.description: A beloved Mexican singer, Mr. Fernández was known for his powerful operatic range and marathon performances, delivered in a signature charro outfit and intricately embroidered sombrero.

node.title: A Comedy Nails the Media Apocalypse
node.description: With “Don’t Look Up,” Adam McKay makes a star-studded allegorical satire that shows the news media whistling past the climate-change graveyard.

node.title: Chris Christie Says Capitol Riot 'Driven From the Top' as Feud With Trump Intensifies
node.description: It "was a driven-from-the-top process executed by C-team players. And that's why it looks like a Keystone Cops operation," he said Sunday.

node.title: Govt space launch moving forward, despite officials' concerns
node.description: A ministerial announcement for a new space centre in Canterbury appears to have jumped the gun, with government officials later confirming the development of aerospace facilities was not certain.

node.title: Software flaw 'being actively exploited', CERT NZ warns
node.description: The Apache Logging security team has rated the security impact rating of the vulnerability, also known as Log4Shell, as critical. Audio

node.title: Property prices rise amid continued supply pressure - REINZ
node.description: The national median house price rose a seasonally adjusted 23.8 percent in the past 12 months to $925,000.

node.title: Children in Park Chance Upon Corpse, Suspected to Be of Woman Missing for Weeks
node.description: Police await forensic confirmation but believe they found the body of 32-year-old Petra Srncova, a senior nurse assistant.

node.title: Telehealth services, a COVID-19 success story, will be made permanent
node.description: Telehealth services will be made a permanent feature of Australia's healthcare system, following its success in connecting millions of Australians to their doctors throughout the pandemic.

node.title: 'An unimaginable drama': At least three dead, six missing after gas explosion collapses apartment in Sicily
node.description: Three children and a couple expecting a baby are among those still missing after a suspected gas explosion collapsed a four-storey building in the Sicilian town of Ravanusa.

node.title: G7 reaffirms support for Ukraine as fears for increased Russian military aggression grows
node.description: Russia faces massive consequences and severe costs if President Vladimir Putin attacks Ukraine, the Group of Seven warn.

node.title: Australia signs historic billion-dollar military deal with South Korea
node.description: The federal government will finalise a $1 billion contract with South Korean defence giant Hanwha, making it Australia's largest military deal with an Asian nation.

node.title: Victoria records 1,290 new COVID-19 cases and two deaths
node.description: There are now 11,649 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 599 people have died in the current outbreak.

node.title: Eight years of dominance not only makes Mercedes the greatest F1 team ever, they are the best in sports history
node.description: Mercedes have been the pinnacle of Formula 1 for eight years and it is now time we recognise them as the greatest team in sports, writes Michael Doyle.

node.title: Auckland DHB meetings shrouded in secrecy
node.description: Auckland District Health Board held an emergency meeting last month but its Covid-19-heavy content is being kept secret, as are the agendas of "informal" meetings it's held weekly during the outbreak.

node.title: 'Terrible gaps' in mental health system for youth and children
node.description: Many district health boards have longer waitlists for youth and children seeking outpatient mental health services than adults. The Mental Health Foundation says it's an "absolute crisis".

node.title: Woman charged with murder over death of man dropped at medical centre
node.description: A woman has been arrested over the death of a man who was dropped at an Auckland medical centre with critical injuries last month.

node.title: New Leader Pushes Teachers’ Union to Take On Social Justice Role
node.description: Becky Pringle, the country’s top Black labor leader, has plunged the National Education Association into the reckoning unfolding in public schools.

node.title: Western Australia set to reveal border reopening date today, tourism industry hails 'light at the end of the tunnel'
node.description: As the WA government prepares to reveal the state's reopening date today, tourism operators urge Premier Mark McGowan to "stay the course" while ensuring the plan is in step with other states and territories.

node.title: Fourth Stimulus Check Update: Monthly $2K Petition 21,000 Signatures Away From 3 Million
node.description: Several other online petitions calling for more direct payments have garnered tens or hundreds of thousands of signatures as well.
